name: fog
content:
fog noun
(WEATHER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 [ U ] a weather condition in which very small drops of water come together to form a thick cloud close to the land or sea, making it difficult to see: thick fog Thick fog has made driving conditions dangerous.heavy fog Their flight was cancelled because of heavy fog.dense fog As the storm cleared, dense fog came down. Mist, fog, and snow are common in this area.fog lifts It took several hours for the fog to lift. Compare
mist noun
Joost Lagerweij/EyeEm/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe fog is expected to have cleared away by midday.We could see a dim shape in the fog.Freezing fog and icy patches are expected to cause problems for motorists tonight.Outside the fields were blanketed in fog.The fog swirled thickly around us.

fog noun
(CONFUSION)
[ S ] informal a confused or uncertain state, usually mentally or emotionally: in a fog of I went home in a fog of disbelief. The government's statement failed to lift the fog surrounding the strange announcement. the fog of war
a state of confusion or of being uncertain, caused by a war: The "fog of war" no doubt explains some of the conflicting accounts of what happened. Things don't always go according to plan in the fog of war.
More examplesFewer examplesYou sometimes have to make choices in a fog of uncertainty.It is a confusing subject for the consumer, so I shall try to clear the fog.In the fog of war, it is easy for the truth to become lost.
